00140 /**
00141    ## FUNCTION:
00142         pte_get_mass
00143   
00144    ## SPECIFICATION:
00145         Returns the mass for a given element
00146   
00147    ## PARAMETERS:       
00148         @ const char *symbol: The symbol of the element in the periodic table
00149   
00150    ## RETURN:
00151         float: mass corresponding to symbol
00152   
00153 */
00154 float pte_get_mass(const char *symbol)
00155 {       
00156         char atom[3] ;
00157         if (symbol != NULL) {
00158                 atom[0] = (char) toupper((int) symbol[0]);
00159                 atom[1] = (char) tolower((int) symbol[1]);      
00160                 atom[2] = '\0' ;
00161         
00162                 int i ;
00163                 for (i = 0; i < ST_nelem ; i++) {
00164                         if ( (ST_pte_symbol[i][0] == atom[0]) && (ST_pte_symbol[i][1] == atom[1]) ) {
00165                                 
00166                                 return ST_pte_mass[i] ;
00167                         }
00168                 }
00169         }
00170 
00171 
00172         return -1 ;
00173 }
00174 
00175 /**
00176    ## FUNCTION:
00177         pte_get_vdw_ray
00178   
00179    ## SPECIFICATION:
00180         Returns the van der walls radius for a given element
00181   
00182    ## PARAMETERS:       
00183         @ const char *symbol: The symbol of the element in the periodic table
00184   
00185    ## RETURN:
00186         float: vdw radius corresponding to symbol
00187   
00188 */
00189 float pte_get_vdw_ray(const char *symbol)
00190 {
00191         char atom[3] ;
00192 
00193         if (symbol != NULL) {
00194                 atom[0] = (char) toupper((int) symbol[0]);
00195                 atom[1] = (char) tolower((int) symbol[1]);
00196                 atom[2] = '\0' ;
00197         
00198                 int i ;
00199                 for (i = 0; i < ST_nelem ; i++) {
00200                         if ( (ST_pte_symbol[i][0] == atom[0]) && (ST_pte_symbol[i][1] == atom[1]) ) {
00201                                 return ST_pte_rvdw[i] ;
00202                         }
00203                 }
00204         }
00205 
00206         return -1 ;
00207 }
00208 
00209 /**
00210    ## FUNCTION:
00211         pte_get_enegativity
00212   
00213    ## SPECIFICATION:
00214         Returns the electronegativity (Pauling) value for a given element
00215   
00216    ## PARAMETERS:       
00217         @ const char *symbol: The symbol of the element in the periodic table
00218   
00219    ## RETURN:
00220         float: electrobegativity of Pauling corresponding to symbol
00221   
00222 */
00223 float pte_get_enegativity(const char *symbol)
00224 {
00225         char atom[3] = "" ;
00226 
00227         if (symbol != NULL) {
00228                 atom[0] = (char) toupper((int) symbol[0]);
00229                 atom[1] = (char) tolower((int) symbol[1]);
00230                 atom[2] = '\0' ;
00231         
00232                 int i ;
00233                 for (i = 0; i < ST_nelem ; i++) {
00234                         if ( (ST_pte_symbol[i][0] == atom[0]) && (ST_pte_symbol[i][1] == atom[1]) ) {
00235                                 return ST_pte_electronegativity[i] ;
00236                         }
00237                 }
00238         }
00239 
00240         return -1 ;
00241 }
00242 
00243 /**
00244    ## FUNCTION:
00245         is_valid_element
00246   
00247    ## SPECIFICATION:
00248         Check if a given string corresponds to an atom element.
00249   
00250    ## PARAMETERS:
00251         @ const char *str : The string to test
00252         @ int tcase       : If = 1, dont take into account the case.
00253   
00254    ## RETURN:
00255         int: -1 if the strig is not an atom element, the index in the periodic table if so.
00256   
00257 */
00258 int is_valid_element(const char *str, int ignore_case)
00259 {
00260         if(str == NULL) return -1 ;
00261         if(strlen(str) <= 0) return -1 ;
00262 
00263         /* Use temporary variable to work on the string */
00264         int i ;
00265         char str_tmp[strlen(str)+1] ;
00266         strcpy(str_tmp, str) ;
00267 
00268         /* Remove spaces and case if asked*/
00269         str_trim(str_tmp) ;
00270         if(ignore_case == 1) {
00271                 str_tmp[0] = tolower(str_tmp[0]) ;
00272                 str_tmp[1] = tolower(str_tmp[1]) ;
00273         }
00274 
00275         /* Loop over */
00276         for (i = 0; i < ST_nelem ; i++) {
00277                 char tmp[3] ;
00278                 tmp[0] = ST_pte_symbol[i][0] ;
00279                 tmp[1] = ST_pte_symbol[i][1] ;
00280 
00281                 /* Remove case if asked */
00282                 if(ignore_case == 1) {
00283                         tmp[0] = tolower(tmp[0]) ;
00284                         tmp[1] = tolower(tmp[1]) ;
00285                 }
00286                 tmp[2] = '\0' ;
00287 
00288                 /* Do the comparison*/
00289                 if(strcmp(str_tmp, tmp) == 0) return i ;
00290         }
00291         
00292         return -1 ;
00293 }
